feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with support for different calculation bases and salary component selections.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
To adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement.

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings.

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection
Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation to access salary proration configuration.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to properly exclude public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
Super admin role with access to payroll settings; existing leave type policies that may be affected by encashment configuration
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role is required to access and modify daily wage calculation settings.

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, leave policy type (calendar days or working days), and approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days.

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, reflected on the payroll table, and calculated daily pay rate used to determine the salary reduction amount.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method, affecting first salary and end-of-service settlement amounts.

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay rate by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances); 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days); 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations; 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible basis set by company policy). Most UAE and KSA companies use 30 custom days to align with labor law requirements.

Salary component options limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation method options limited to Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days; only super admins can define and modify these settings
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if two days are public holidays and the leave policy is based on 22 working days, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days (22 minus 2), not the full 22 days.

Calculation results vary depending on month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), and different calculation methods can significantly impact final wage calculations for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when configuring leave encashment, allowing visibility of policy impact before finalizing changes

Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and must be selected appropriately based on payroll requirements; day calculation type selection (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days) affects how daily rates are computed
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and integrates with leave management and employee record systems to process approved unpaid leave requests.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, the company's public holiday calendar, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies and affect how leave is valued during end-of-service
Interacts with the payroll system to apply calculated daily deductions to monthly employee pay; related to Leave Encashment feature which uses similar daily rate calculation logic
The daily wage calculator interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions, including first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations.

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days in the month. ; Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays from the total working days specified in the leave policy. ; Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, which triggers an automatic salary deduction calculated using the daily wage calculator.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law.

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Calculations performed when an employee's employment ends; Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies; Salary components: Elements of compensation used in calculations (Basic, Allowances); Calculation method: The basis for computing daily wage (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days)

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee that is not paid and results in deductions from monthly salary; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deduction amounts on a per-day basis; Leave Policies: Configuration settings that define how different leave types are handled in the system

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
